events.name: Chicago Blackhawks at Detroit Red Wings

headlines.description: — Connor Bedard had a goal and two assists to lead the Chicago Blackhawks to a 5-1 win over the Detroit Red Wings on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Connor Bedard scores, gets 2 assists to lead Blackhawks over Red Wings 5-1

events.name: Los Angeles Kings at Pittsburgh Penguins

headlines.description: — Kevin Fiala broke a tie with 8:08 left with his 500th NHL point to help the Los Angeles Kings beat the Pittsburgh Penguins 3-2 on Sunday to open a...
headlines.shortLinkText: Fiala breaks tie with 500th NHL point, Kings open 6-game trip with 3-2 win over Penguins

events.name: Carolina Hurricanes at Toronto Maple Leafs

headlines.description: — Taylor Hall and Logan Stankoven scored in the third period, and the Carolina Hurricanes rallied to beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 5-4 on Sunday night for their fourth straight win.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hall, Stankoven score in 3rd period to rally Hurricanes to 5-4 win over Maple Leafs

headlines.description: — Leevi Merilainen made 29 saves in his third NHL start and the Ottawa Senators beat the Utah Mammoth 4-2 on Sunday night, with both teams completing a back-to-back set.
headlines.shortLinkText: Merilainen makes 29 saves in 3rd NHL start to help the Senators beat the Mammoth 4-2

headlines.description: — Tyler Seguin’s goal in the closing seconds of the first period held up as the winner and Casey DeSmith stopped 30 of 31 shots as the Dallas Stars beat the Seattle Kraken 2-1 on Sunday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Seguin's late first-period goal gives Stars 2-1 win over Kraken

headlines.description: — Jesper Wallstedt made 36 saves for his second career NHL shutout, Matt Boldy had a goal and an assist and the Minnesota Wild beat the Calgary Flames 2-0 on Sunday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Wallstedt makes 36 saves, Boldy has goal and assist in Wild's 2-0 win over Flames

headlines.description: — Gavin Brindley scored 1:08 into overtime and the Colorado Avalanche beat the Vancouver Canucks 5-4 on Sunday night.

headlines.description: — Rookie Beckett Sennecke had his first two-goal game, Leo Carlsson extended his scoring streak to 10 games with two power-play goals, and the Anaheim Ducks beat the Winnipeg Jets 4-1 on Sunday night for their seventh straight victory.
headlines.shortLinkText: Sennecke, Carlsson each score twice in surging Ducks' 7th straight win, 4-1 over Jets
